memberdef.argsstring: (snd_ctl_t *ctl, snd_ctl_elem_info_t *info, unsigned int element_count, unsigned int member_count, long min, long max, long step)
memberdef.name: snd_ctl_add_integer_elem_set

briefdescription.para: Create and add some user-defined control elements of integer type.

detaileddescription.para:
ctl
A handle of backend module for control interface.
info
Common iformation for a new element set, with ID of the first new element.
element_count
The number of elements added by this operation.
member_count
The number of members which a element has to represent its states.
min
Minimum value for each member of the elements.
max
Maximum value for each member of the elements.
step
The step of value for each member in the elements.
Zero on success, otherwise a negative error code. This function creates some user elements with integer type. These elements are not controlled by device drivers in kernel. They can be operated by the same way as usual elements added by the device drivers.

The name field of id must be set with unique value to identify new control elements. After returning, all fields of id are filled. A element can be identified by the combination of name and index, or by numid.
All of members in the new elements are locked. The value of each member is initialized with the minimum value.

listitem.para: A element with ID id already exists.
Some arguments include invalid value; i.e. ID field in info has no name, or the number of members is not between 1 to 127.
Out of memory, or there are too many user elements.
This backend module does not support user elements of integer type.
Device unplugged.

simplesect.title: Compatibility:
simplesect.para: This function is added in version 1.1.2.

memberdef.argsstring: (snd_ctl_t *ctl, snd_ctl_elem_info_t *info, unsigned int element_count, unsigned int member_count, long long min, long long max, long long step)
memberdef.name: snd_ctl_add_integer64_elem_set

briefdescription.para: Create and add some user-defined control elements of integer64 type.

detaileddescription.para:
ctl
A handle of backend module for control interface.
info
Common iformation for a new element set, with ID of the first new element.
element_count
The number of elements added by this operation.
member_count
The number of members which a element has to represent its states.
min
Minimum value for each member of the elements.
max
Maximum value for each member of the elements.
step
The step of value for each member in the elements.
Zero on success, otherwise a negative error code. This function creates some user elements with integer64 type. These elements are not controlled by device drivers in kernel. They can be operated by the same way as usual elements added by the device drivers.

The name field of id must be set with unique value to identify new control elements. After returning, all fields of id are filled. A element can be identified by the combination of name and index, or by numid.
All of members in the new elements are locked. The value of each member is initialized with the minimum value.

listitem.para: A element with ID id already exists.
Some arguments include invalid value; i.e. ID has no name, or the number of members is not between 1 to 127.
Out of memory, or there are too many user elements.
This backend module does not support user elements of integer64 type.
Device unplugged.

simplesect.title: Compatibility:
simplesect.para: This function is added in version 1.1.2.

memberdef.argsstring: (snd_ctl_t *ctl, snd_ctl_elem_info_t *info, unsigned int element_count, unsigned int member_count)
memberdef.name: snd_ctl_add_boolean_elem_set

briefdescription.para: Create and add some user-defined control elements of boolean type.

detaileddescription.para:
ctl
A handle of backend module for control interface.
info
Common iformation for a new element set, with ID of the first new element.
element_count
The number of elements added by this operation.
member_count
The number of members which a element has to represent its states.
This function creates some user elements with boolean type. These elements are not controlled by device drivers in kernel. They can be operated by the same way as usual elements added by the device drivers.

The name field of id must be set with unique value to identify new control elements. After returning, all fields of id are filled. A element can be identified by the combination of name and index, or by numid.
All of members in the new elements are locked. The value of each member is initialized with false.

listitem.para: A element with ID id already exists.
Some parameters include invalid value; i.e. ID has no name, or the number of members is not between 1 to 127.
Out of memory, or there are too many user elements.
This backend module does not support user elements of boolean type.
Device unplugged.

simplesect.title: Compatibility:
simplesect.para: This function is added in version 1.1.2.

memberdef.argsstring: (snd_ctl_t *ctl, snd_ctl_elem_info_t *info, unsigned int element_count, unsigned int member_count, unsigned int items, const char *const labels[])
memberdef.name: snd_ctl_add_enumerated_elem_set

briefdescription.para: Create and add some user-defined control elements of enumerated type.

detaileddescription.para:
ctl
A handle of backend module for control interface.
info
Common iformation for a new element set, with ID of the first new element.
element_count
The number of elements added by this operation.
member_count
The number of members which a element has to represent its states.
items
Range of possible values (0 ... items - 1).
labels
An array containing items strings.
Zero on success, otherwise a negative error code. This function creates some user elements with enumerated type. These elements are not controlled by device drivers in kernel. They can be operated by the same way as usual elements added by the device drivers.

The name field of id must be set with unique value to identify new control elements. After returning, all fields of id are filled. A element can be identified by the combination of name and index, or by numid.
All of members in the new elements are locked. The value of each member is initialized with the first entry of labels.

listitem.para: A control element with ID id already exists.

Some arguments include invalid value; i.e. element_count is not between 1 to 127, or items is not at least one, or a string in labels is empty, or longer than 63 bytes, or total length of the labels requires more than 64 KiB storage.
Out of memory, or there are too many user control elements.
This driver does not support (enumerated) user controls.
Device unplugged.

simplesect.title: Compatibility:
simplesect.para: This function is added in version 1.1.2.

memberdef.argsstring: (snd_ctl_t *ctl, snd_ctl_elem_info_t *info, unsigned int element_count, unsigned int member_count)
memberdef.name: snd_ctl_add_bytes_elem_set

briefdescription.para: Create and add some user-defined control elements of bytes type.

detaileddescription.para:
ctl
A handle of backend module for control interface.
info
Common iformation for a new element set, with ID of the first new element.
element_count
The number of elements added by this operation.
member_count
The number of members which a element has to represent its states.
Zero on success, otherwise a negative error code. This function creates some user elements with bytes type. These elements are not controlled by device drivers in kernel. They can be operated by the same way as usual elements added by the device drivers.

The name field of id must be set with unique value to identify new control elements. After returning, all fields of id are filled. A element can be identified by the combination of name and index, or by numid.
All of members in the new elements are locked. The value of each member is initialized with the minimum value.

listitem.para: A element with ID id already exists.
Some arguments include invalid value; i.e. ID has no name, or the number of members is not between 1 to 511.
Out of memory, or there are too many user elements.
This backend module does not support user elements of bytes type.
Device unplugged.

simplesect.title: Compatibility:
simplesect.para: This function is added in version 1.1.2.

memberdef.argsstring: (snd_ctl_t *ctl, const snd_ctl_elem_id_t *id, unsigned int member_count, long min, long max, long step)
memberdef.name: snd_ctl_elem_add_integer

briefdescription.para: Create and add an user-defined control element of integer type.

detaileddescription.para: This is a wrapper function to snd_ctl_add_integer_elem_set() for a control element. This doesn't fill the id data with full information, thus it's recommended to use snd_ctl_add_integer_elem_set(), instead.

memberdef.argsstring: (snd_ctl_t *ctl, const snd_ctl_elem_id_t *id, unsigned int member_count, long long min, long long max, long long step)
memberdef.name: snd_ctl_elem_add_integer64

briefdescription.para: Create and add an user-defined control element of integer64 type.

detaileddescription.para: This is a wrapper function to snd_ctl_add_integer64_elem_set() for a single control element. This doesn't fill the id data with full information, thus it's recommended to use snd_ctl_add_integer64_elem_set(), instead.

briefdescription.para: Create and add an user-defined control element of boolean type.

detaileddescription.para: This is a wrapper function to snd_ctl_add_boolean_elem_set() for a single control element. This doesn't fill the id data with full information, thus it's recommended to use snd_ctl_add_boolean_elem_set(), instead.

memberdef.argsstring: (snd_ctl_t *ctl, const snd_ctl_elem_id_t *id, unsigned int member_count, unsigned int items, const char *const labels[])
memberdef.name: snd_ctl_elem_add_enumerated

briefdescription.para: Create and add a user-defined control element of enumerated type.

detaileddescription.para: This is a wrapper function to snd_ctl_add_enumerated_elem_set() for a single control element. This doesn't fill the id data with full information, thus it's recommended to use snd_ctl_add_enumerated_elem_set(), instead.
This function is added in version 1.0.25.

briefdescription.para: Create and add a user-defined control element of IEC958 type.

detaileddescription.para:
ctl
A handle of backend module for control interface.
id
ID of the new control element.
This function creates an user element with IEC958 type. This element is not controlled by device drivers in kernel. It can be operated by the same way as usual elements added by the device drivers.

The name field of id must be set with unique value to identify a new control element. After returning, all fields of id are filled. A element can be identified by the combination of name and index, or by numid.
A member in the new element is locked and filled with zero.

listitem.para: A control element with ID id already exists.
ID has no name.
Out of memory, or there are too many user elements.
This backend module does not support user elements of IEC958 type.
Device unplugged.

memberdef.name: snd_ctl_tlv_do

memberdef.argsstring: (snd_ctl_t *ctl, const snd_ctl_elem_id_t *id, unsigned int *tlv, unsigned int tlv_size)
memberdef.name: snd_ctl_elem_tlv_read

briefdescription.para: Read structured data from an element set to given buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
ctl
A handle of backend module for control interface.
id
ID of an element.
tlv
An array with members of unsigned int type.
tlv_size
The length of the array.
0 on success otherwise a negative error code The format of an array of tlv argument is: tlv[0]: Type. One of SND_CTL_TLVT_XXX. tlv[1]: Length. The length of value in units of byte. tlv[2..]: Value. Depending on the type.
Details are described in <sound/tlv.h>.

briefdescription.para: Write structured data from given buffer to an element set.

detaileddescription.para:
ctl
A handle of backend module for control interface.
id
ID of an element.
tlv
An array with members of unsigned int type. The second member must represent total bytes of the rest of array.
0
on success
>0
on success when value was changed
<0
a negative error code
The format of an array of tlv argument is: tlv[0]: Type. One of SND_CTL_TLVT_XXX. tlv[1]: Length. The length of value in units of byte. tlv[2..]: Value. Depending on the type.
Details are described in <sound/tlv.h>.

briefdescription.para: Process structured data from given buffer for an element set.

detaileddescription.para:
ctl
A handle of backend module for control interface.
id
ID of an element.
tlv
An array with members of unsigned int type. The second member must represent total bytes of the rest of array.
0
on success
>0
on success when value was changed
<0
a negative error code
The format of an array of tlv argument is: tlv[0]: Type. One of SND_CTL_TLVT_XXX. tlv[1]: Length. The length of value in units of byte. tlv[2..]: Value. Depending on the type.
Details are described in <sound/tlv.h>.
